meanings.definition: A person who is known for being disdainful or dismissive, especially in matters of honor or integrity.
meanings.sent1: The caviler scoffed at the idea of following the rules.
meanings.sent2: She was often seen as a caviler due to her constant criticism of others' actions.
meanings.sent3: The caviler's refusal to participate in the team's charity event raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a caviler cast a shadow over his credibility in the community.
meanings.sent5: The caviler's sneering remarks left a lasting impression on those around him.

meanings.definition: To behave in a disdainful or dismissive manner, especially in matters of honor or integrity.
meanings.sent1: He would caviler at any suggestion that didn't align with his beliefs.
meanings.sent2: She tends to caviler whenever someone questions her decisions.
meanings.sent3: The child would caviler whenever asked to clean up his toys.
meanings.sent4: The politician's tendency to caviler at his opponents' arguments cost him support.
meanings.sent5: The professor would caviler at students who didn't meet his high standards.
